text: Juan García Garza (5 February 1905 – 12 October 1973), nicknamed "El Peralvillo", was a Mexican actor and screenwriter. He wrote the screenplays of the films of comedian Germán Valdés, beginning in Tender Pumpkins (1949), and was credited for the street talk featured in Valdés's films.Monsiváis, p. 114.Hershfield & Maciel, p. 76.García Riera, p. 170. ==Selected filmography as actor== *The Circus (1943) *Romeo and Juliet (1943) *A Day with the Devil (1945) *Enamorada (1946) *Río Escondido (1948) *Tender Pumpkins (1949) *Rough But Respectable (1949) *The King of the Neighborhood (1950) *The Mark of the Skunk (1950) *Sinbad the Seasick (1950) *The Honesty of the Lock (1950) *Oh Darling!
